title: Blood on the Clocktower Custom Script

oneOf.title: Set of character icon URLs
oneOf.description: For non-traveller characters, the icons should be regular alignment and flipped alignment, for travellers they should be unaligned, good alignment and evil alignment

ability.title: Character ability
examples: You start knowing that 1 of 2 players is a particular Townsfolk.
Each night, Minions choose who babysits Lil' Monsta's token & "is the Demon". A player dies each night*. [+1 Minion]
Each night*, choose a player: they die. The 1st Outsider this kills becomes an evil Fang Gu & you die instead. [+1 Outsider]

flavor.title: Character flavor text
examples: Bloodstains on a dinner jacket? No, this is cooking sherry. How careless.
Certainly madam, under normal circumstances, you may borrow the Codex Malificarium from the library vaults. However, you do not seem to be a member.
It is a fine night for a stroll, wouldn't you say, Mister Morozov? Or should I say... BARON Morozov?

firstNight.title: First night wake-up priority. 0 means this character doesn't wake during the first night.

firstNightReminder.title: First night Storyteller reminder
examples: Show the Townsfolk character token. Point to both the *TOWNSFOLK* and *WRONG* players.
Wake all Minions, allow them to choose a babysitter :reminder:

otherNight.title: Other nights wake-up priority. 0 means this character doesn't wake during other nights.

otherNightReminder.title: Other nights Storyteller reminder
examples: Wake all Minions, allow them to choose a babysitter :reminder: A player might die :reminder:

The Fang Gu chooses a player. :reminder: If they chose an Outsider (once only): Replace the Outsider token with the spare Fang Gu token. Put the Fang Gu to sleep. Wake the target. Show the *YOU ARE* and Fang Gu tokens & give a thumbs-down. :reminder:

remindersGlobal.title: Global character reminder tokens, which will be selectable even when the character is not in play.

setup.title: Whether this character has a ability that is relevant for the game setup.

jinxes.title: Jinxes with other characters on this script

id.title: The ID of the other character this one is jinxed with.

reason.title: The Jinx explanation
examples: If the Cannibal gains the Butler ability, the Cannibal learns this.
The Mathematician learns if the Lunatic attacks a different player(s) than the real Demon attacked.

special.title: Special app integration features for this character

type.title: The integration type, where the feature will be used.
type.description:
Currently supported values are:
 selection - during character selection,
 signal - during night signaling,
 ability - when clicking on the character token,
 vote - during a vote,
 reveal - at the end of the game, before characters are revealed,
 player - an ability that can be initiated by the player

name.title: The feature name reference
name.description: This is a list of the currently implemented special features and will be growing over time.

oneOf.title: Special ability text value
oneOf.description: The text value that will be used by the special ability.

oneOf.title: Special ability number value
oneOf.description: The numeric value that will be used by the special ability.

time.title: At which point during the game can the ability be used

global.title: Global ability scope
global.description: If it's a global ability that can be used without the character being in play, this property defines on which characters it can be used. This does not work on non-player characters, because they are not considered to be on the Script.

oneOf.title: Official character ID
oneOf.description: If you want to include official characters in the script, it is sufficient to provide their ID as a string

id.title: The ID property must be called '_meta' for the Script metadata object.

hideTitle.title: Whether the script title / author should be hidden on the app

almanac.title: A link to the script's almanac page

bootlegger.title: A list of homebrew rules that are to be used for this script
bootlegger.description: Any (optional) homebrew rules that should be shown on the character sheet can be listed here, up to a limit of 10.

items.title: A homebrew rule
examples: If the Snake Charmer swaps with the Demon on the first night, they learn their Minions and Bluffs instead of the original Demon.

firstNight.title: The relative First Night order of characters on this script.
firstNight.description: A custom first night order for this script can be provided in the form of an array here, with optional special entries for 'dusk', 'minioninfo', 'demoninfo' and 'dawn'.

items.title: Character ID of an on-script character in the first night order

otherNight.title: The relative Other Nights order of characters on this script.
otherNight.description: A custom other night order for this script can be provided in the form of an array here, with optional special entries for 'dusk' and 'dawn'.

items.title: Character ID of an on-script character in the other night order
